poem:
### Morning Headlines

Trump insists on ceasefire\n  
like a king in a fairy tale,\n  
while snow drifts in Alaska,\n  
and Putin waits,\n  
sipping tea perhaps,\n  
pondering the chessboard\n  
of the world,\n  
its pieces scattered\n  
across icy plains,\n  
as words rise and fall\n  
like winter breaths,\n  
vanishing before \n  
they touch the air.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
